questions.question: …………………….. are not always cowards.
questions.description: When an adjective is used to denote a class of people, it is always used with the. The cautious means the same as cautious people.

questions.question: The richest ……………………….. not always the happiest.
questions.description: Adjectives used to denote a class of persons are always plural and take the plural verb.

questions.question: Blessed as ……………………….
questions.description: When an adjective is used to denote a class of people, it is always used with the.

questions.question: …………………….. is uncertain.
questions.description: Sometimes adjectives are used to denote some abstract quality. In this case also they are used with the article the.

questions.question: ………………………. we know nothing.
questions.description: No article is used in this expression.

questions.question: I must have the terms down in ……………………….
I am afraid his situation is going from ………………………..
questions.description: No articles are used in these expressions

questions.question: The unemployed ……………………….. losing hope.
questions.description: When the + adjective refers to a well-known group of people, it is plural.

questions.question: The government should do something to solve …………………………
questions.description: These expressions cannot be used with the possessive ’s.

questions.question: I am ………………………… in my family.
questions.description: Superlatives are often used without a noun if the meaning is clear.

questions.question: I can’t afford ………………………….
questions.description: The correct structure is that + adjective /adverb + article + noun

questions.question: ………………………… is she?
questions.description: The correct structure is how + adjective / adverb + a/an + noun. Note that the article goes after the noun in this special structure.
